question_content.barrons:question:
Neutron stars are believed to be the highly compressed remnants of exploding stars (supernovas) and thus

(i) _________ of one of the most (ii) _________ processes in nature.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
products; violent.

If neutron stars are the remnants or remaining traces of exploding stars, they are products or results of violent natural processes.

Causes is incorrect. The neutron stars did not cause the explosions; they were caused by the explosions.

Precursors is incorrect. Neutron stars come into evidence after a supernova explodes. Thus, they are not precursors or forerunners of the explosion.

Equivocal is incorrect. There is nothing equivocal or inconclusive about the explosion of a star.

Theoretical is incorrect. The formation of a neutron star is not a theoretical or hypothetical process.
